{{Italic title}}{{Speciesbox | name = ''Triops longicaudatus'' | fossil_range = {{fossil_range|Triassic|Recent}} | image = Triops-longicaudatus-dorsal-ventral-edit2.jpg | taxon = Triops longicaudatus | authority = ([[John Lawrence LeConte|LeConte]], 1846) | synonyms = ''Apus longicaudatus'' <small>LeConte, 1846</small> | range_map = Triopsrange.PNG | range_map_caption = The range of ''Triops longicaudatus'' }} '''''Triops longicaudatus''''' (commonly called '''longtail tadpole shrimp''', '''American tadpole shrimp''', or '''rice tadpole shrimp''') is a freshwater [[crustacean]] of the order [[Notostraca]], resembling a miniature [[horseshoe crab]]. It is characterized by an elongated, segmented body, a flattened shield-like brownish [[carapace]] covering two thirds of the thorax, and two long filaments on the abdomen. ''Triops'' refers to its three eyes, and ''longicaudatus'' refers to the elongated tail structures. ''Triops longicaudatus'' is found in freshwater ponds and pools, often in places where few higher forms of life can exist. Like its relative ''[[Triops cancriformis]]'', the longtail tadpole shrimp is considered a [[living fossil]] because its basic prehistoric morphology has changed little in the last 70 million years, exactly matching their ancient fossils. ''Triops longicaudatus'' is one of the oldest animal species still in existence.<ref name="Grzimek">Grzimek's Animal Life Encyclopedia. Volume 02 – Protostomes. Chapter 14 – [http://www.answers.com/Notostraca?cat=technology Order Notostraca]</ref><ref name="Encarta">Encarta Encyclopedia 2005. Article – Branchiopoda</ref><ref name="Zooplankton">{{cite web |url=http://www.cst.cmich.edu/users/mcnau1as/zooplankton%20web/Triops/Triops.html |title=''Triops longicaudatus'' |work=Zooplankton of the Great Lakes |author=David Wooten |publisher=[[Central Michigan University]] |accessdate=October 4, 2010}}</ref>
==Classification== ''Triops longicaudatus'' is a member of the crustacean class [[Branchiopoda]], which primarily contains freshwater animals with [[gill]]s on their legs. The class Branchiopoda is divided into the subclasses Sarsostraca, containing [[fairy shrimp]], and [[Phyllopoda]], containing all other members ([[cladocera]]ns, [[clam shrimp]]s, and the [[Notostraca|tadpole shrimp]]). The subclass name, literally meaning ''leaf-footed'', is derived from their flat, leaflike appendages. Notostracans are placed in the infraclass Calamanostraca, which also contains the extinct [[Kazacharthra]].<ref name="Grzimek"/>
==Structure== {{Multiple image | direction = vertical | header = Comparison of ''T. longicaudatus'' with ''T. cancriformis'' | width = 220 | align = right | image1 = Triops longicaudatus.jpg | caption1 = ''Triops longicaudatus'' | image2 = Triops cancriformis2.jpg | caption2 = ''Triops cancriformis'' }} ''Triops longicaudatus'' is usually greyish yellow or brown in color, and differs from many other species by the absence of the second [[Maxilla (arthropod)|maxilla]]. Apart from ''[[Triops cancriformis]]'', it is the only tadpole shrimp species whose individuals display as many as three reproductive strategies: bisexual, unisexual ([[Parthenogenesis|parthenogenetic]]), and [[Hermaphrodite|hermaphroditic]]; see [[Triops longicaudatus#Reproduction|below]]. ''Triops cancriformis'' is easily recognizable by its yellow [[carapace]] with dark spots, whilst ''T. longicaudatus'' individuals have a uniform carapace. The species also appeared about 50 million years later, and, as its name suggests, its elongated tail structures ([[cercopod]]s) are often nearly as long as the rest of the body; including the cercopods, the body may reach {{convert|75|mm|abbr=on}} in length.<ref>{{Cite book |editor=June Latting & Peter Glanville Rowlands |year=1995 |title=The California Desert: an Introduction to Natural Resources and Man's Impact |volume=2 |publisher=June Latting |place=Riverside, CA |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=zSdHAAAAYAAJ&q=triops+longicaudatus+mm&dq=triops+longicaudatus+mm&hl=en&sa=X&ei=peFvT_ydC4mViAL86_3IBQ&ved=0CGAQ6AEwBjgK |isbn=9780963690852 |oclc=37199208 |page=278}}</ref>
[[File:Triops anatomy new.png|thumb|left|External anatomy of ''Triops longicaudatus'' (click on image for captions)]] The head of ''Triops longicaudatus'' is typical of crustaceans and consists of five segments, but there is a tendency toward reduction of cephalic [[appendage]]s. The ''trunk'' is not distinctly divided into [[thorax]] and [[abdomen]]. Most trunk segments bear appendages. Zoologists find it difficult to decide where the thorax stops and the abdomen begins; the debate is seemingly endless. The first eleven trunk segments each bear a single pair of limbs. They are followed by segments that are fused similarly to those of [[millipede]]s, and as a result, each segment bears up to six pairs of limbs. The trunk ends with a region of limbless segments. Some zoologists consider the thorax to consist of the two regions with appendages, and the abdomen the region without appendages. Others believe the region of fused segments to be part of the abdomen.<ref name="Lander">{{cite web |url=http://webs.lander.edu/rsfox/invertebrates/triops.html |publisher=[[Lander University]] |work=Invertebrate Anatomy OnLine |title=''Triops longicaudatus'', Tadpole Shrimp |date=June 19, 2006 |author=Richard Fox |accessdate=October 4, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101001030622/http://webs.lander.edu/rsfox/invertebrates/triops.html |archivedate=October 1, 2010 |df= }}</ref> For clarity, this article uses "thorax" to mean the two body regions with limbs.
===Carapace=== There is a [[carapace]] present, but no [[cephalothorax]], since no thoracic segment is fused with the head. The terms ''carapace'' and ''cephalothorax'' often are confused, but should not be. The carapace of crustaceans is a fold of the body wall of the fifth head segment.
===Head=== [[File:Mouthparts.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Mouthparts: 1 – ventral groove; 2 – labrum (upper lip); 3 – mandible]] The head bears a pair of [[Dorsum (biology)|dorsal]] [[compound eye]]s that lie close to each other and are nearly fused together. The compound eyes are generally sessile (not stalked). In addition, there is a [[Nauplius (larva)|naupliar]] [[ocellus]] (the "third eye") between them. The compound eyes are on the surface of the head, but the ocellus is deep within the head. All the eyes, however, are easily visible through the shell covering of the head. A distinct horizontal groove, known as the mandibular groove, marks the division between the anterior three head segments and the posterior two. Posterior to it is the cervical groove, marking the division between the head and the thorax.
On the [[Anatomical terms of location|ventral]] side of the head is a lenslike window, admitting light to the naupliar eye, which is aimed both dorsally and ventrally. The first antennae (antennules) are small, slender filaments on the ventral surface of the head, at about the same level as the eyes. The second antennae are similar and lie laterally to the first. They are nonfunctioning. The large, well-developed [[Mandible (arthropod)|mandibles]] oppose each other across the ventral midline. The opposing surfaces bear strong brownish teeth. As the crustacean periodically opens and closes the mandibles the teeth move apart and close together. Of the usual crustacean head appendages, only the mandibles are well developed. In ''Triops longicaudatus'', the larger second maxillae are absent, only [[Maxilla (arthropod)|maxillules]] being present.<ref name="Lander"/>
===Thorax=== [[File:A thoracopod.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Magnified leg (thoracopod): 1–5 – endites; 6 – endopod; 7 – exopod; 8 – epipod; 9 – protopod]] The anterior thorax consists of eleven segments, each bearing a pair of appendages, called thoracopods or [[Decapod anatomy#Thorax / Pereon|pereiopod]]s. None of the thoracopods are modified into [[Decapod anatomy#Thorax / Pereon|maxilliped]]s for feeding. The posterior thorax consists of 16–25 segments, incompletely separated to form ''rings''. Each ring may consist of as many as six fused segments and bear up to six pairs of appendages (there are 54–66 limbs altogether).
Most of the thoracic appendages resemble each other, but the first eleven pairs are best developed. There is a slight tendency to regional specialization and the first pair of legs is unlike the rest. It is an elongated, [[Claw#Arthropods|cheliped]]-like structure with a sensory function, while all the other appendages aid in feeding, respiration, and locomotion. In females, the eleventh pair of legs is modified into brood pouches. The many legs posterior to the eleventh pair move the spent feeding and respiratory currents away.<ref name="Lander"/>
===Abdomen=== The posterior 5–14 rings at the end of the body do not bear appendages. At the end of the body is a pleotelson (fusion of the last abdominal segment and the [[telson]]) connected to long, multisegmented [[Decapod anatomy#Abdomen / Pleon|uropods]].<ref name="Lander"/>
===Feeding behavior=== The feeding method of tadpole shrimps is similar to that proposed for the ancestral [[crustacean]]. The anterior appendages (second pair to tenth pair) stir sediments and swirl muddy water into the wide, midventral food groove. The ''gnathobases'' (inward-facing lobes at the base of the leg) guide food anteriorly to the mouth. The large flat exopods (outward-facing lobes at the end of the leg) stir and lift the sediments. Fine silt particles and water escape easily, but large, coarse food particles are torn into smaller pieces by the blade-like, inward-facing lobes called ''endopods'' at the end of the leg.
===Internal anatomy=== The heart of tadpole shrimps is a long dorsal tube in the anterior eleven trunk segments. It has a pair of [[ostium (anatomy)|ostia]] in each of these segments. Sometimes [[hemoglobin]] is present in its blood and the crustacean may be pink as a result. The [[Excretion|excretory]] organs are the paired maxillary [[gland]]s, located on the segment of the second maxilla. The long looped ducts of these glands can be seen in the carapace. The role of the maxillary glands is primarily [[Osmoregulation|osmoregulatory]]. [[Nitrogen]], in the form of [[ammonia]], is lost by [[diffusion]] across the [[gill]] surfaces.<ref name="Lander"/>
==Reproduction and development== ===Reproduction=== {{double image|right|Vernal Pools 2.jpg|180|Vernal Pools 3.jpg|120|A typical [[vernal pool]] during the wet season|Another vernal pool, this one dried out}} ''Triops'' ''longicaudatus'' displays several reproductive strategies. Individuals may reproduce sexually, but this is rare, as most populations are highly male- or female-biased. [[Parthenogenesis]] (development from unfertilized eggs) is the most common reproductive strategy. Some populations, however, consist of [[hermaphrodite]]s who fertilize each other. Different populations display different strategies or combinations of strategies, and may therefore, be considered separate [[species]] or [[subspecies]] in the future.
In females, the eleventh pair of legs is modified into egg sacs, where the eggs are carried for several hours. The eggs are released in batches, have a thick shell, and can stand freezing temperatures as well as drought, enabling the population to survive from one season to the next. The eggs have to dry out completely before being submerged in water again in order to hatch successfully; they may remain in a state of [[diapause]] for up to 20 years. These eggs may have helped ''Triops longicaudatus'', as well as other notostracans, to survive the various natural disasters and [[mass extinction]]s to date.<ref name="Grzimek"/><ref name="Zooplankton"/>
===Life cycle=== To complete their lives, tadpole shrimps depend on the changing nature of the [[Vernal pool|temporary waters]] they inhabit. During the dry season (summer and fall), their offspring stay inside the eggs. As the pool fills with rainwater during the winter and spring, they hatch and feed on [[fairy shrimp]]s and other invertebrates. The first larval stage (the [[metanauplius]]) is orange in color. It has a single eye, six legs, and develops through [[instar]]s (growth stages). Each instar ends with [[Ecdysis|shedding]] the exoskeleton. The number of segments and appendages increases as ''Triops '' grow, and they slowly change to greyish brown. In approximately eight days, they reach maturity and lay eggs. Adult ''Triops'' die as the pools dry up. ''Triops'' generally live for about 20–90 days if the pool does not dry up.<ref name="Encarta"/>
{{Multiple image | header = Larval development (not to scale) | direction = horizontal | align = center | image1 = Tadpole shrimp cyst hatching.jpg | width1 = 201 | caption1 = Metanauplius hatches from the egg, having three pairs of limbs: the [[antenna (biology)|antennules]], [[antenna (biology)|antennae]] and [[mandible (arthropod)|mandibles]]. | image2 = Tadpole shrimp larva 2.jpg | width2 = 174 | caption2 = Three hours later, the trunk segments become defined and the [[telson]] begins to form. | image3 = Tadpole shrimp larva 1.jpg | width3 = 114 | caption3 = 7 h after hatching | image4 = Tadpole shrimp larva 3.jpg | width4 = 120 | caption4 = After 15 h, it has the major characteristics of the adult form. | image5 = Tadpole shrimp larva 4.jpg | width5 = 102 | caption5 = 24 h after hatching, it very nearly resembles a miniature version of the adult form. | image6 = Triops Longicaudatus at about 48 hours old.jpg | width6 = 225 | caption6 = Two days after hatching, the ''Triops'' has essentially completely taken the appearance of an adult. }}
==Ecology== [[File:Triopslongred1.jpg|thumbnail|Red variant of Triops longicaudatus raised in captivity.]] ''T. longicaudatus'' is the most widespread notostracan species, and may be found in western North America, South America, Japan, South Korea, and several [[Pacific Islands]]. It is most active at a temperature of approximately {{convert|20|C|F}}, and is usually found scratching the mud at the bottom of pools, searching for [[Benthic zone|benthic]] food. Triops collect food particles by straining the water with hairs on their limbs. Loose food particles are collected in a groove running down the underside of the body lengthwise, and held together by a sticky secretion until they are swallowed by their very small (2 mm wide) mouth. The tiny mouth is deep in its underbelly, and while the animal is capable of breaking up plant roots or dead fish, it is incapable of chasing down and eating prey larger than it is.
===Diet=== [[File:Triops longicaudatus eating his companion - Cannibalism.jpg|thumb|A ''Triops'' eating his companion]] [[Tadpole shrimps]] are [[omnivorous]] and may eat algae, insects, and other [[Organic matter|organic debris]]; they are known to chase very small fry, tadpoles, and [[Oligochaeta|oligochaete]] worms.<ref name="Lander"/> In general, they eat anything organic that is smaller than they are, which even may include their siblings (they are [[Cannibalism (zoology)|cannibalistic]]). In turn, ''Triops longicaudatus'' are eaten by frogs and birds.<ref name="billingsgazette">{{cite news |url=http://www.billingsgazette.com/news/state-and-regional/wyoming/article_f1622053-a9e8-5063-b4aa-8b6a1ad0b939.html |publisher=[[Billings Gazette]] |title=Wet weather revives crustaceans prehistoric heritage |author=Allison Batdorff |date=June 29, 2005}}</ref>
===Interaction with humans=== [[File:Triops longicaudatus2.jpg|thumb|right|Adult 2.5 cm pet ''Triops'' in aquarium]] The species is considered a human ally against the [[West Nile virus]], as the individuals consume ''[[Culex]]'' mosquito larvae. They also are used as a [[biological agent]] in Japan, eating weeds in rice [[Paddy field|paddies]]. In [[Wyoming]], the presence of ''Triops longicaudatus'' usually indicates a good chance of the hatching of [[American spadefoot toads|spadefoot frog]]s.
Dried eggs of ''Triops'' ''longicaudatus'' are sold in kits to be raised as aquarium pets, sold under the name of "aquasaurs", "trigons" or "triops". These are most often of the greenish-brown variety, but the red variant is fairly common among enthusiasts. Captive ''Triops'' are frequently kept in aquariums and fed a diet consisting mainly of carrots, shrimp pellets and dried shrimp. Often they are also given living shrimp and daphnia as live prey. Because they can feed on just about anything, they are also fed lunch meat, potatoes, crackers, etc. They will often feed themselves by grazing on algae and other grunge from the bottom and sides of the tank and on small particles clinging to sponge filters or to [[Marimo]] moss balls, which are often cultured alongside Triops.
==Distribution== [[File:Triopslongredcanc.jpg|350px|thumbnail|Though they make fine captive tank mates, Triops longicaudatus red and Triops cancriformis are not likely to be found together in the wild, nor to feed on carrots. Marimo moss balls are also unlikely companions.]]
''Triops longicaudatus'' is widespread in [[North America]]. In [[Canada]], it is found only in the provinces of [[Alberta]], [[Saskatchewan]] and [[Manitoba]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.aquatax.ca/crayfish.html |title=Saskatchewan Macrocrustacea |author=Dale Parker |accessdate=October 4, 2010}}</ref> It is widespread throughout the contiguous [[United States]], [[Mexico]], and [[Hawaii]], but not [[Alaska]]. Tadpole shrimps may be found in parts of [[South America]], in ([[Argentina]] and [[Galápagos Islands]]),<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.biota.org.br/pdf/v4cap17.pdf |publisher=biota.org.br/ |title=CLASSE BRANCHIOPODA}}</ref> the [[West Indies]], and the [[Pacific Islands]], including [[Japan]] and [[New Caledonia]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://mytriops.com/articles/triops_species2.stm |publisher=MyTriops.com |title=Species Descriptions |accessdate=October 4, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111006181802/http://mytriops.com/articles/triops_species2.stm |archivedate=October 6, 2011 |df= }}</ref>

{{Infobox television | show_name = Uncovering Our Earliest Ancestor: The Link | image = | image_size = | image_alt = | caption = | show_name_2 = The Link | genre = [[Documentary film|Documentary]] | creator = | based_on = | developer = | writer = David Attenborough | screenplay = | story = | director = | creative_director = | presenter = David Attenborough | starring = | voices = | narrated = David Attenborough | theme_music_composer = | opentheme = | endtheme = | composer = | country = United Kingdom | language = English | num_seasons = 1 | num_episodes = 1 | list_episodes = | executive_producer = | producer = Lucie Ridout | editor = | location = [[Hesse]], Germany | cinematography = | camera = | runtime = {{duration|m=59|s=00}} | company = | distributor = [[BBC]] | budget = | channel = [[BBC One]] (UK)
[[History (U.S. TV channel)|History Channel]] (US)
[[ZDF]] (Germany)
[[NRK]] (Norway) | picture_format = | audio_format = | first_run = | released = | first_aired = {{Start date|2009|5|29}} | last_aired = | preceded_by = | followed_by = | related = | website = http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b00ksh5y | website_title = Uncovering Our Earliest Ancestor: The Link | production_website = http://www.atlanticproductions.tv/productions/the-link/ | production_website_title = Atlantic Productions }} [[File:Darwinius masillae PMO 214.214.jpg|thumb|left|''Darwinius masillae'' fossil]]'''''Uncovering Our Earliest Ancestor: The Link''''' is a one-hour television documentary made by [[Atlantic Productions]] for the [[BBC]], first aired on 26 May 2009 on [[BBC One]]. It explores the story behind the discovery of an early [[primate]] [[fossil]], ''[[Darwinius masillae]]'', nicknamed [[Darwinius|Ida]], in a shale quarry in [[Germany]]. The fossil is believed to be around 47 million years old, and is extraordinarily well-preserved.{{Cite press release | title = Exclusive BBC One documentary uncovers our earliest ancestor | date = 19 May 2009 | publisher = BBC | url = http://www.bbc.co.uk/pressoffice/pressreleases/stories/2009/05_may/19/ancestor.shtml | accessdate = 15 March 2013}} Originally unearthed in 1983, Ida lay in the hands of a private collector for 20 years before it was shown to a Norwegian [[paleontologist]], [[Jørn Hurum|Dr Jørn Hurum]].{{Cite web | last = Randerson | first = J. | url = https://www.theguardian.com/science/2009/may/19/ida-fossil-missing-link | title = Fossil Ida: extraordinary find is 'missing link' in human evolution | date = 19 May 2009 | publisher = [[The Guardian]] | accessdate = 15 March 2013}} Realising that Ida could turn out to be a significant [[transitional form|missing link]] between modern primates, [[lemur]]s and lower [[mammal]]s, he persuaded the [[Natural History Museum at the University of Oslo|Natural History Museum]] in [[Oslo]] to purchase the fossil and assembled an international team of experts to study it. Their findings were announced in a press conference and the online publication of a scientific paper on 19 May 2009.{{Cite journal | last1 = Franzen | first1 = J. L. | last2 = Gingerich | first2 = P. D. | last3 = Habersetzer | first3 = J. | last4 = Hurum | first4 = J. H. | last5 = Von Koenigswald | first5 = W. | last6 = Smith | first6 = B. H. | editor1-first = Hawks | editor1-last = J.| doi = 10.1371/journal.pone.0005723 | title = Complete primate skeleton from the Middle Eocene of Messel in Germany: morphology and paleobiology| journal = PLoS ONE | volume = 4 | issue = 5 | pages = e5723 | year = 2009 | url = http://www.plosone.org/article/fetchObjectAttachment.action?uri=info%3Adoi%2F10.1371%2Fjournal.pone.0005723&representation=PDF| format = PDF| pmid = 19492084| pmc = 2683573 | ref = harv| bibcode = 2009PLoSO...4.5723F }} The BBC programme was narrated by [[David Attenborough]]. An alternative edit of the programme entitled ''The Link'' debuted on the [[History (UK TV channel)|History Channel]] on 25 May 2009 in a two-hour slot.{{Cite web | url = http://science4grownups.com/archives/2009/05/27/reviews/looking-at-the-history-channels-the-link-542 | title = Looking at The History Channel's The Link | date = 27 May 2009 | publisher = Science4Grownups | accessdate = 15 March 2013}} == References == {{reflist}} == External links == * {{BBC programme}} * [http://www.atlanticproductions.tv/productions/the-link/ Atlantic Productions: The Link] * [http://www.revealingthelink.com Revealing the Link] {{BBC Natural History Unit}} [[Category:BBC television documentaries]] [[Category:2009 television specials]] [[Category:Documentary films about prehistoric life]] {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2012}} {{sci-documentary-stub}}

{{Use dmy dates|date=February 2012}} {{Infobox civilian attack |title = Winnenden school shooting |image = ARS_Winnenden.png |caption = "Albertville" Secondary School in Winnenden on 12 March 2009 |location = [[Winnenden]], [[Baden-Württemberg]], [[Germany]] |coordinates = {{coord|48|52|07|N|9|23|56|E|region:DE_type:event|display=inline}} |target = |date = 11 March 2009 |time = 09:30 – 13:08 |timezone = [[UTC+01:00]] |type = [[School shooting]], [[mass murder]], [[murder-suicide]], [[Spree killer|shooting spree]] |fatalities = '''Winnenden:''' 13 (including 12 at the Albertville-Realschule)
'''Wendlingen:''' 3 (including the perpetrator) '''Total: 16''' |injuries='''Winnenden:''' 7
'''Wendlingen:''' 2 '''Total: 9'''{{cite news|url=http://www.polizei-waiblingen.de/servlet/PB/menu/1284644/index.html?ROOT=1122864|title=Amoklauf in Winnenden|date=11 March 2009|publisher=Local Police authorities|accessdate=12 March 2009}} |perp = Tim Kretschmer |weapons = [[Beretta 92|Beretta 92FS INOX]]{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/fotostrecke/fotostrecke-40557-3.html#backToArticle=612775|work=Spiegel Online|title=Die Tatwaffe}} }} The '''Winnenden school shooting''' occurred on the morning of 11 March 2009 at a [[secondary school]] in [[Winnenden]], Baden-Württemberg, in southwestern Germany, followed by a shootout at a car dealership in nearby [[Wendlingen]].{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/7936817.stm |title='German school gunman 'kills 15' |accessdate=11 March 2009 |publisher=BBC News |date=11 March 2009}}{{cite web |url=http://www.dw-world.de/dw/article/0,,4088804,00.html |title= German Police Say School Shooting Kills at Least Nine |accessdate=11 March 2009 |publisher=[[Deutsche Welle]] |date=11 March 2009}} The shooting spree resulted in 16 deaths, including the [[suicide]] of the perpetrator, 17-year-old Tim Kretschmer, who had graduated from the school one year earlier. He also injured nine people during the incident. ==Shootings== ===Albertville school shooting=== {{Location map many |Germany |label = [[Winnenden]] |label_size = 85 |position = top |lat_deg = 48 |lat_min = 52 |lat_sec = 07 |lon_deg = 09 |lon_min = 23 |lon_sec = 56 |label2 = [[Wendlingen]] |label_size2 = 75 |position2 = bottom |lat2_deg = 48 |lat2_min = 40 |lat2_sec = 29 |lon2_deg = 09 |lon2_min = 22 |lon2_sec = 54 |border = black |caption = Locations of the incident within Germany |float = right |width = 200 }} In the [[Albertville-Realschule]] at approximately 09:30 ([[Central European Time|CET]]), Kretschmer first began shooting with a [[9mm|9 mm]] [[Beretta 92FS]] [[Semi-automatic pistol|semi-automatic]] [[pistol]], which he had taken from his parents' bedroom.{{cite web|url=http://www.blick.ch/news/ausland/wieso-kam-tim-an-diese-pistole-herr-kretschmer-114233|title=Wieso kam Tim an diese Pistole, Herr Kretschmer?|accessdate=19 March 2009 |publisher=[[Blick|www.blick.ch]] |date=12 March 2009|language=German}}{{cite news | url=http://www.spiegel.de/panorama/justiz/0,1518,612732,00.html | title=Protokoll eines Massenmords | accessdate=11 March 2009 | date=11 March 2009 |work=Der Spiegel | language=German }}{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/7937554.stm |title=How German school shooting unfolded |accessdate=11 March 2009 |publisher=BBC |date=11 March 2009}} Eyewitness reports state that Kretschmer started on the first upstairs floor,{{cite web |url=http://www.stuttgart-journal.de/tp/pool/nachrichten-stuttgart/sj/2009/03/12/news/amoklauf-von-winnenden-polizei-konstruiert-genauen-tathergang/|title=Polizei konstruiert genauen Tathergang (Police reconstruct exact events)|accessdate=13 March 2009|publisher=Stuttgart Journal|date=13 March 2009|language=German}} where he made a beeline for two top-floor classrooms and a chemistry laboratory.{{cite web|url=http://www.hs.fi/ulkomaat/artikkeli/Kouluampuja+iski+Stuttgartin+l%C3%A4hell%C3%A4+Saksassa/1135244209543 |title=Ainakin kymmenen kuoli kouluammuskelussa Saksassa |accessdate=11 March 2009 |publisher=[[Helsingin Sanomat]] |date=11 March 2009 |language=Finnish}} In the first classroom, Kretschmer fatally shot five students in the head at close range without warning. He then entered the next classroom, killed two more students, and wounded nine more, two of whom would die of their wounds en route to the hospital. As Kretschmer left the room to reload his weapon, the teacher reportedly closed the door and locked it. After unsuccessfully trying to shoot off the lock, Kretschmer then moved on to the chemistry laboratory, where he shot and killed the teacher. Students escaped Kretschmer by jumping out of windows.[http://www.spiegel.de/international/germany/chronology-of-a-mass-murder-the-scope-of-this-disaster-is-incomprehensible-a-612780.html "Chronology of a Mass Murder: 'The Scope of this Disaster Is Incomprehensible'"] In the three targeted classrooms, he killed nine students (eight female and one male, 14–16 years old) and a female teacher.{{cite web|url=http://www.bild.de/BILD/news/bild-english/world-news/2009/03/13/tim-kretschmer-shooting-rampage-animated-video/teen-gunman-tragic-school-killing-spree-recreated.html|title=Teen gunman's tragic school killing spree recreated|work=bild.com|date=13 March 2009}} He shot most of his victims in the head.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/7938228.stm |title=Sad scene at German massacre school |publisher=BBC News |last=Hughes |first=Dominic |date=11 March 2009 |accessdate=11 March 2009}} Kretschmer fired more than 60 rounds at the school.[http://www.sat1.de/news/index.php?action=showarticle&article_id=44545&sourceurl=/panorama/ Sat1.de] Because the majority of the victims were female, some speculated that Kretschmer specifically targeted females.{{cite news| url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/worldnews/article-1161139/Police-uncover-astonishing-weapons-cache-German-teenager-country-hit-wave-copycat-threats.html |location=London |work=Daily Mail | title=Police uncover astonishing weapons cache of another German teenager as country is hit by wave of copycat threats | first=Allan | last=Hall | date=13 March 2009}} The school headmaster broadcast a coded announcement ("Mrs ''Koma'' is coming", which is [[Run amok|amok]] spelled backwards){{cite web|url=http://www.faz.net/s/Rub77CAECAE94D7431F9EACD163751D4CFD/Doc~EA0BCD28DE1E14F69BC31230BF76705D4~ATpl~Ecommon~Scontent.html|title=''Polizeitaktik und Notfallpläne "Frau Koma kommt"''|accessdate=23 March 2009|publisher=[[Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung|FAZ]]|date=13 March 2009|language=German}} alerting the teachers of the situation; they locked classroom doors. This coded alert had been used by German educators after the [[Erfurt massacre|Erfurt school massacre]] in April 2002. After receiving an emergency call from a student at 09:33 local time, three police officers reached the scene two minutes later and entered the school, interrupting the shooting spree. Kretschmer shot at them and fled the building, killing two female teachers in the hall as he departed. He killed a total of 12 people at the school. A quantity of unused ammunition was recovered from the school. "It appears the perpetrator may have intended to do far more harm at the school than he managed," said chief criminal investigator Ralf Michelfelder. ===Escape and carjacking=== [[File:Psychiatric institution nearby Winnenden school shooting.jpg|thumb|left|180px|Psychiatric institution nearby Winnenden school where Kretschmer killed a 56-year-old employee]] [[File:Volkswagen Sharan.jpg|thumb|left|A car involved before carjacking.]] Kretschmer fled the scene and killed the 56-year-old gardener (caretaker) of a nearby psychiatric hospital in the park.{{cite web |url=http://www.abendzeitung.de/panorama/92317|title=Das Protokoll des Blutbades: "Rennt, rennt!"|accessdate=11 March 2009 |publisher=[[Abendzeitung]]|date=11 March 2009}}{{cite news |url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/europe/article5894847.ece |title=German school killer Tim Kretschmer warned of massacre on chatroom |work=The Times |location=London |accessdate=23 March 2009 |date=12 March 2009 | first1=Fran | last1=Yeoman | first2=Philippe | last2=Naughton}} Large numbers of police officers secured the school building and searched for Kretschmer throughout Winnenden for hours without success. News reports confirmed that Kretschmer was on the run and warned motorists not to pick up any hitchhikers. At approximately 10:00, the gunman [[carjacked]] a [[Volkswagen Sharan]] minivan at a car park in Winnenden. From his position on the rear seat, the gunman ordered the driver Igor Wolf to drive towards [[Wendlingen]], {{convert|40|km|mi|abbr=on}} from Winnenden. The gunman and the driver went westwards into the suburbs of [[Stuttgart]], the [[Baden-Württemberg]] state capital, travelling through the towns and districts of [[Waiblingen]], [[Fellbach]] and [[Bad Cannstatt]], before driving on the B14 [[dual carriageway]] through the Heslach Tunnel onto the A81 [[autobahn]] motorway towards [[Böblingen]] and [[Tübingen]]. The two drove onto the B27 dual carriageway before leaving on the B313 to [[Nürtingen]]. Igor Wolf later reported that, when asked why he was doing this, the gunman replied, "For fun, because it is fun." (''"Aus Spaß, weil es Spaß macht.“''){{cite web|url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/,tt4l2/panorama/747/462366/text/ |title=Vater von Tim K. will Waffen nicht mehr anrühren| publisher=sueddeutsche.de| accessdate=20 March 2009|date=20 March 2009|language=German}} According to Wolf, the gunman revealed his intentions as he was loading his pistol magazines during the ride: "Do you think we will find another school?" (''"Meinst du, wir finden noch eine andere Schule?"''). Wolf says he quickly changed the conversation then.{{cite web|url=http://www.stern.de/panorama/:Winnenden-Geisel-Ich-Kinder/659386.html?p=2|title=Interview "Ich wollte für meine Kinder weiterleben"| publisher=stern.de| accessdate=2 April 2009|date=29 March 2009|language=German}} Shortly after 12:00, just before the Wendlinger junction to the A8 ''autobahn'', the hostage steered the car onto the grass verge and jumped from the vehicle toward a [[police car|police patrol car]].{{verification failed|date=July 2016|reason=cite URL is dead; no mention on 2012 archive of URL from of time 12:00 p.m., although noon is consisent with guardian source}} ===Wendlingen shootout=== The gunman immediately left the car and ran towards the nearby industrial area, entering a [[Volkswagen]] car showroom through the main entrance. He threatened a salesperson and demanded a key for one of the vehicles. The salesperson escaped while the gunman was distracted. The gunman shot and killed another salesperson and a customer, firing 13 bullets into both people. As he reloaded, another salesperson and visitor fled through the rear exit. The gunman emerged at about 12:30 and shot at a passing car. The driver escaped without injury. The police started to arrive and a shootout began. An officer fired eight shots at the gunman, hitting him once in each leg. The gunman returned to the car showroom, firing 12 shots from within the building at police from nearby [[Nürtingen]], who were gradually surrounding the building. He left the rear of the building and ran across a yard to a neighbouring business complex, where he shot and injured two police officers in an unmarked police vehicle. According to police reports, at this point Kretschmer continued to shoot at random, shooting at nearby buildings and people, including an employee of a firm who was trying to lock the door. Witnesses described observing the gunman as he reloaded his pistol before shooting himself in the head.{{cite news | url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/,tt2m1/panorama/719/461345/text/ | title=Das wortlose Töten des Tim K. | accessdate=11 March 2009 | date=11 March 2009 | publisher=sueddeutsche.de | language=German }} The final seconds of the shootout were captured with a cell phone video camera.{{cite web|url=http://www.bild.de/BILD/news/2009/03/12/winnenden/video-die-letzten-sekunden/des-schul-amok-killers.html|title=Die letzten Sekunden des Amok-Killers von Winnenden|accessdate=1 July 2018|publisher= bild.de |date= 12 March 2009|language=German|deadurl=yes}} According to forensic evidence, during the whole shooting spree, the gunman fired a total of 112 rounds. ==Perpetrator== {{Infobox criminal | name = Tim Kretschmer | birth_date = 26 July 1991 | birth_place = | death_date = 11 March 2009 (aged 17) | death_place = [[Wendlingen]], Baden-Württemberg, Germany | occupation = Student }} '''Tim Kretschmer''' (26 July 1991 – 11 March 2009) lived with his parents in the neighbouring municipality of [[Leutenbach, Baden-Württemberg|Leutenbach]].{{cite news |url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/europe/article5887953.ece |title=German school massacre gunman dies in police shootout after chase |work=The Times |location=London |accessdate=11 March 2009 |date=11 March 2009 | first=Philippe | last=Naughton}}{{cite web |url=http://www.tagesanzeiger.ch/panorama/vermischtes/Amoklauf-in-Schule-im-badenwuerttembergischen-Winnenden/story/12303508 |title=17-Jähriger läuft Amok – 16 Tote – Täter Tim K. erschossen. |publisher=Tages Anzeiger Panorama |accessdate=11 March 2009 |date=11 March 2009 |language=German}} He had graduated from Albertville [[Realschule]] in 2008 with relatively poor grades.{{cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/europe/article5891507.ece|title=Tim Kretschmer, the boy who killed 15 in school rampage, stole pistol from his father’s arsenal|last=Yeoman|first=Fran|author2=David Charter |date=12 March 2009|work=The Times |location=London |accessdate=12 March 2009 }} ===Personal life=== Kretschmer's failing grades had prevented him from entering an [[apprenticeship]]. He was attending a commercial high school (Donner + Kern) in [[Waiblingen]] to prepare for an apprenticeship for a commercial career. Several accounts described him as suffering from [[Depression (mood)|depression]].{{cite web |url=http://www.bz-berlin.de/archiv/der-amok-schuetze-17-war-wegen-depressionen-in-der-nervenklinik-die-arzte-konnten-seine-kranke-seele-nicht-heilen-article395103.html|title= Polizei fand Killerspiele, Horrorfilme und Pornobilder auf dem Computer von Kretschmer +++ Er war Einzelgänger und hatte keine Freundin – Der Amok-Schütze (17) war wegen Depressionen in der Nervenklinik. Die Arzte konnten seine kranke Seele nicht heilen|publisher=[[Berliner Zeitung]] |accessdate=18 March 2009 |date=13 March 2009 |language=German}}{{cite web|url=http://www.bild.de/BILD/news/bild-english/world-news/2009/03/12/school-shooting-in-winnenden-germany/tim-kretschmer-was-suffering-from-depression-before-killing-spree.html|title=Tim Kretschmer suffered from depression before killing spree|accessdate=23 March 2009|publisher=bild.de|date=13 March 2009}} Kretschmer was described by a friend as "a lonely and frustrated person who felt rejected by society".{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2009/mar/12/school-shooting-germany-letter|title=Teenage killer wrote letter to parents saying he 'couldn't go on'|last=Davies|first=Lizzy|date=12 March 2009|work=The Guardian |location=London |accessdate=12 March 2009 }} An anonymous friend described Kretschmer as a quiet student who began to withdraw from his peers.{{cite news | url=http://www.spiegel.de/panorama/justiz/0,1518,612673,00.html | title=Tim K. – der Junge ohne Eigenschaften | accessdate=11 March 2009 | date=11 March 2009 |work=Der Spiegel | language=German }} He was an avid table tennis player and had hoped to become a professional player. Marko Habijanec, a Croatian table tennis player who coached Kretschmer at the Erdmannhausen sports club between 2000 and 2003, remembers him as being "a bit spoiled", with his mother fulfilling many of his demands.{{cite web | url=http://www.jutarnji.hr/vijesti/clanak/art-2009,3,13,,155619.jl | title=Marko Habijanec: Trenirao sam monstruma | date= 13 March 2009 |work=[[Jutarnji list]] | language=Croatian | accessdate=15 March 2009}} According to Habijanec, Kretschmer had great difficulties accepting defeat: he would have a temper [[tantrum]], yelling and throwing his racket. The coach said that, having a high opinion of his own abilities, Kretschmer openly denigrated his teammates. When Habijanec discussed Tim's attitude with his mother, he discovered she sided fully with her son. Media reports say he enjoyed playing the video game ''[[Counter-Strike]]'' and playing with [[airsoft]] guns.{{cite news | url=http://www.spiegel.de/panorama/justiz/0,1518,612826,00.html | title= Polizei hat Hinweise auf Tatmotiv | accessdate=12 March 2009 | date=12 March 2009 |work=Der Spiegel | language=German }}[http://www.berlinonline.de/berliner-kurier/nachrichten/timkretschmerpsychogrammeineskillers/ Tim Kretschmer: Psychogramm eines Killers] Commentators also noted that "game addiction is a symptom of something wrong and not a cause".{{cite news |url=http://timesonline.typepad.com/comment/2009/03/do-you-think-th.html|title=Did video games cause the shooting in Germany?}} He also shot his guns in the forest behind his home and also in the basement of his house. On his last day alive, Kretschmer played the video game ''[[Far Cry 2]]'' online as "JawsPredator1".{{cite web |url=http://www.news-times.de/Artikelsenden/10581289/Aktuelle-Nachrichten/20107239|title=Verwirrung um Therapie von Tim K. – Eltern des Amokschützen dementieren Behandlung – Schütze spielte vor der Tat Killerspiel| accessdate=19 March 2009 | date=11 March 2009 | publisher=news-times.de | language=German}} ===Online activities=== He had profiles at "[[MyVideo]].de", Kwick.de and other websites.{{cite web|url=http://www.news24.com/News24/World/News/0,,2-10-1462_2485515,00.html|title=Teen 'played video games' | accessdate=19 March 2009 | date=14 March 2009 | publisher=[[News24|www.news24.com]] }} He often played poker with his classmates in the "Cafe Tunix" after school hours in Waiblingen.{{cite web |url=http://www.bild.de/BILD/news/2009/03/13/winnenden/tim-kretschmer-letzter-tag/mathe-klausur-pizza-poker-letzter-tag-vor-amok-lauf.html|title=''Tim Kretschmers letzter Tag'' (''Tim Kretschmer's last day'')| accessdate=11 March 2009 | date=11 March 2009 | publisher=Bild | language=German}} After inspection of his computer, officers found that Kretschmer was interested in [[Dominatrix|sadomasochistic scenes where a man is bound and humiliated by women]]. He viewed such a movie the evening before his attacks.[http://www.sueddeutsche.de/panorama/537/486948/text/ Tim brauchte Hilfe], ''Süddeutsche Zeitung'', 9 September 2009. {{de icon}} ===Mental health problems=== Kretschmer did not have a criminal record. The press reported that in 2008, Kretschmer had received treatment as an [[in-patient]] at the Weissenhoff Psychiatric Clinic near the town of [[Heilbronn]]. After being discharged, Kretschmer was supposed to continue his treatment as an [[out-patient]] in Winnenden, but ended his treatment.{{cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/europe/article5898272.ece|title=Teenage killer Tim Kretschmer had stopped treatment for depression| accessdate=11 March 2009 | date=11 March 2009|work=The Times |location=London | first1=Fran | last1=Yeoman | first2=David | last2=Charter}} According to police and clinic staff, he had been treated repeatedly for clinical [[Depression (mood)|depression]] on an out-patient basis in 2008. His family rejected these claims and maintained that he never received psychiatric treatment.{{Cite web |url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/panorama/84/461708/text/ |title=War Tim K. in Therapie? |accessdate=13 March 2009 |publisher=Süddeutsche Zeitung |date=14 March 2009 |language=German}} According to a psychiatric report prepared for the prosecutor's office, Kretschmer met five times with a therapist and talked about his growing anger and violent urges; the therapist informed Kretschmer's parents. ===Possible motives=== In a press conference on 12 March, police reported that Kretschmer had announced his killing spree several hours ahead of time on [[Krautchan.net|Krautchan]]. The next day, police determined that this message had not been written on Kretschmer's computer and was a forgery.{{cite web|url=http://www.rtl.de/rtlaktuell/rtl_aktuell_artikel.php?article=26422&pos=1|title=Polizeipanne? Innenminister redet sich raus|accessdate=23 March 2009|publisher=RTL.de|date=2009-03-13|language=German}} Three weeks before the shooting, Kretschmer had written a letter to his parents, saying that he was suffering and could not go on. In an interview in 2014, Kretschmer's parents stated that they had always loved their son and that they did not have an explanation for his actions. They have since changed their name and moved to a different city. == Victims == Kretschmer killed 15 people, including nine students and three teachers at the school, before killing himself. They are:[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/germany/4980428/Germany-school-shootings-Massacre-survivor-thought-it-was-a-prank.html Germany school shootings: Massacre survivor thought it was a prank][http://www.abendzeitung.de/panorama/94617 "Nichts ist, wie es einmal war"], ''[[Abendzeitung]]'' (22 March 2009) {| style="background-color: transparent; width: 100%;" | width="33%" align="left" valign="top" | '''At Winnenden:''' * Jacqueline Hahn, 16 (student) * Ibrahim Halilaj, 17 (student) * Franz Josef Just, 57 (worked at the psychiatric hospital) * Stefanie Tanja Kleisch, 16{{cite news| url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/news/article2317426.ece | location=London | work=The Sun | first=Allan | last=Hall | title=I was shot 3 times Chantal slumped dead by the door | date=13 March 2009}} (student) * Michaela Köhler, 26 (trainee teacher) * Selina Marx, 15 (student) * Nina Denise Mayer, 24 (trainee teacher) * Viktorija Minasenko, 16 (student) * Nicole Elisabeth Nalepa, 16 (student) * Chantal Schill, 15 (student) * Jana Natascha Schober, 15 (student) * Sabrina Schüle, 24 (trainee teacher) * Kristina Strobel, 16 (student) | width="33%" align="left" valign="top" | '''At Wendlingen:''' * Denis Puljic, 36 (worked in the car dealership) * Sigurt Peter Gustav Wilk, 46 (customer at the car dealership) |} == Source of the gun, indictment of the father == Police raided the Kretschmer family house at about 11:00 a.m. on the day of the shooting. Tim Kretschmer's father legally owned 15 guns as a member of a local marksmen club ("[[Schützenverein]]" in German).{{cite web|url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5g-7Dbm7W0ADoXhfKS2O_sUrZu4NwD96S47T01|title=Teen kills 15 in Germany before taking own life|last=Gera|first=Vanessa |publisher=The Associated Press|accessdate=12 March 2009}} One 9 mm [[Beretta]] handgun was found missing, along with several hundred rounds of ammunition.{{Cite journal |url=http://www.dw-world.de/dw/article/0,,4088804,00.html |title=Teenage Gunman Killed by Police After German School Shooting |publisher=[[Deutsche Welle]] |date=11 March 2009|accessdate=11 March 2009 |postscript=}} Fourteen of the guns were kept in a [[gun safe]], while the Beretta had been kept unsecured in the bedroom.{{cite news|url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/panorama/758/461384/text/ | title=Schwarz wie der Tod | accessdate=11 March 2009 | date=11 March 2009 | publisher=sueddeutsche.de | language=German }} Five days after the event, prosecutors initiated preliminary proceedings against the father for [[negligent homicide]], since the gun had not been properly locked away as required by law.{{cite news|url=http://www.bild.de/BILD/news/2009/03/16/amok-killer-tim-kretschmer/staatsanwaltschaft-leitet-ermittlungsverfahren-gegen-vater-ein.html | title=Staatsanwaltschaft ermittelt gegen Vater | accessdate=16 March 2009 | date=16 March 2009 | publisher=Bild.de | language=German }} The police confiscated the 14 remaining guns. The father announced that he would voluntarily relinquish his gun ownership authorization. In November 2009, the Public Prosecutor's Department in Stuttgart announced that the father had been indicted on charges of negligent homicide, bodily injury caused by negligence, and violation of the weapons law.{{Cite web|url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/,ra4l1/panorama/532/495854/text/|title=Tim K.s Vater angeklagt|date=27 November 2009|work=sueddeutsche.de|postscript=|language=de}} On 10 February 2011, the state court in Stuttgart found the father guilty of involuntary manslaughter in 15 cases, bodily harm caused by negligence and the negligent abandonment of a weapon. The father received a [[suspended sentence]] of one year and nine months,{{Cite web|url=http://www.thelocal.de/society/20110210-33015.html|title=Winnenden father found guilty of manslaughter|date=10 February 2011|work=thelocal.de|postscript=}} and appealed the verdict.{{cite news|title=Vater des Täters geht in Revision|newspaper=Focus|date=3 July 2011|url=http://www.focus.de/panorama/welt/amoklauf-von-winnenden-vater-des-taeters-geht-in-revision_aid_642552.html|language=German}} The appeals court handed out a suspended sentence of one year and six months in 2013.{{cite news|title=Das neue Leben der Eltern des Tim K.|newspaper=Die Welt|date=18 May 2014|url=https://www.welt.de/vermischtes/article128124230/Das-neue-Leben-der-Eltern-des-Tim-K.html|language=German}} [[File:The school building of Winnenden school shooting.JPG|thumb|right|200px|Candles in front of the Albertville school]] [[File:Winnenden Schule 02 (RaBoe).jpg|thumb|right|200px|Candles in front of the Albertville school]] ==Response== German President [[Horst Köhler]] said he was "appalled and saddened" by the killings. Köhler and his wife expressed their condolences to the victims and their families and friends.{{cite news|url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/germany/0,1518,612683,00.html|title=POLITICAL REACTIONS: Merkel 'Deeply Shaken' By School Shootings|work=Der Spiegel|date=11 March 2009|accessdate=11 March 2009}} Chancellor [[Angela Merkel]] described the shootings as "incomprehensible". "It is unimaginable that in just seconds, pupils and teachers were killed – it is an appalling crime," she told reporters. "This is a day of mourning for the whole of Germany," she continued. Baden-Württemberg [[List of Ministers-President of Baden-Württemberg|Minister-President]] [[Günther Oettinger]] travelled to the scene of the crime by helicopter shortly after the news broke. Oettinger spoke of a "horrible and in no way explainable crime". He also expressed his condolences to the victims, students and families. "This has touched all of Baden-Württemberg. The school, the town, the future, education, and raising children – to destroy these things like that is especially cruel." The [[European Parliament]] held a minute of silence to honour the dead. An [[Ecumenism|ecumenical]] Church service was held in Winnenden the evening of the shooting, with Protestant, Catholic, and Muslim clerics officiating. All German flags were flown on [[half-staff]] until 13 March, in memorial of the victims.{{cite web|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2009-03/11/content_10994626.htm|title=School shooting shocks Germany, chancellor appalled|first=Yan |date=11 March 2009|publisher=Xinhuanet|accessdate=12 March 2009}} In the days following the event, some politicians called for legal consequences, including a total prohibition of all shooting video games, better monitoring of gun club members, a directive to have all ammunition deposited with police, and a provision to have gun club members store their weapons at the club house. Others dismissed such demands as "placebos".{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/0,1518,613050,00.html| title=CSU will Killerspiel-Verbot, SPD Kontrolle über Schützenvereine|work=Der Spiegel | date=13 March 2009|language=German|accessdate=13 March 2009}} The families of five victims wrote an open letter to Chancellor Angela Merkel, President Horst Köhler, and Baden-Württemberg Minister President Günther Oettinger with demands for consequences. They called for a prohibition on youths' access to guns in gun clubs, less violence on TV, and a prohibition of violent video games. They also called for reporting of these incidents without highlighting the perpetrator, so as to minimize the chance of copycats.{{cite web|url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/,tt4l1/panorama/895/462513/text/|title=Opferfamilien fordern Killerspiel-Verbot| publisher=sueddeutsche.de| date=21 March 2009|language=German|accessdate=21 March 2009}}{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/wams_print/article3420239/Winnenden-Eine-Tat-aus-der-man-nicht-klug-werden-kann.html|title=Winnenden: Eine Tat, aus der man nicht klug werden kann|publisher=[[Die Welt|www.welt.de]]|date=21 March 2009|language=German|accessdate=24 March 2009}} The German government passed legislation in June 2009 to improve handgun security with an electronic nationwide weapons registry, increased age limitations for large-calibre weapons, and unannounced, random inspections in gun-owner homes to ensure requirements for locked gun storage were met. Obligatory biometric security systems should be introduced once technically feasible. In May 2009, Germany announced plans to ban games such as [[paintball]] on the grounds that they "trivialise and encourage violence".{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/europe/8041320.stm |work=BBC News | title=Germany moves to outlaw paintball | date=9 May 2009}}{{cite news| url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/germany/5291891/Germany-to-ban-paintball-in-wake-of-high-school-shooting.html |work=The Daily Telegraph |location=London | title=Germany to ban paintball in wake of high school shooting | date=7 May 2009}} The legislature did not ban fighting games such as paintball, gotcha and laserdrome; did not limit the number of guns owned and did not pass a requirement to store guns with shooting clubs or restrictions regarding ammunition storage in private households.{{cite web|url=http://www.morgenpost.de/politik/article1115547/Bundestag_billigt_verschaerftes_Waffenrecht.html|title=Bundestag billigt verschärftes Waffenrecht|publisher=[[Berliner Morgenpost]]|date=18 June 2009|language=German|accessdate=23 June 2009}} == Further reading == * Schober, Hardy: ''Mein Sonnenkind: Wie ich meine Tochter beim Amoklauf in Winnenden verlor und nun gegen die Waffenlobby kämpfe.''
